meanings.definition: A trace of a bad or undesirable quality or substance.
meanings.sent1: The taints of dishonesty were evident in his actions.
meanings.sent2: The food had a strange taints that made it inedible.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a taints of mystery in the old house.
meanings.sent4: The taints of jealousy colored her perception of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The taints of regret lingered in the air after the argument.

meanings.sent1: Careless waste disposal taints the environment.
meanings.sent2: The factory's emissions taints the nearby river.
meanings.sent3: The spilled ink taints the pristine white paper.
meanings.sent4: His lies taints the trust between them.
meanings.sent5: The scandal taints the reputation of the company.

meanings.definition: To affect with a bad or undesirable quality.
meanings.sent1: Negative comments can taints a person's self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The bad weather taints our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The burnt toast taints the whole kitchen with its smell.
meanings.sent4: The corruption taints the integrity of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The mistake taints his otherwise flawless record.
